messages.content:
Andy,

 There are a number of elements to developing as a comic, stage time is a big one. However, writing (and rewriting), reading, rehearsing, and research are important as well. So even when you can't make it out to open mics you can develop your skills as a comics. 

Below is a good resource site for performing stand-up.

http://www.standupcomedyclinic.com/

Thanks, man. I'm not a member of anything right now, but I'll look into it. This week I don't think I can make it to anything except the open mic in Gary, but I'll try to start checking out other stuff. Thanks for the info. I appreciate it. Andy

Andy, 

Are you a member of the Chicago Suburban Comedy Scene? If not it is a good place to see whats going on in areas outside the city. And there is The Chicago Comedy Community and The New Chicago Comedy Scene on Facebook as well.
If you have a Monday free Riddle Comedy Club in Alsip has a pretty good open mic. It starts at 8pm.

Farley
Andy, Saw you Wednesday at "D" Performance ComedyTheater Open Mic.Very good set! (AKA Farley)
